comment: This teacher gives out an UNGODLY amount of textbook work. She also enjoys reporting students for cheating even if they prove they aren't, so choose your teacher wisely. This one is weird

I had her in person one semester and she was okay. I took her online course and it was awful. She was not willing to work with me in any way when issues arose. Do not take her online course under any circumstances!!!

With this being an 8 week course I found it very challenging and overwhelming. She was very passionate about the course and making sure you understood everything but I wouldn't recommend taking it in the summer. She was still a great professor!

Terrible professor!!! Reported me multiple times for cheating on lockdown exams, which was not the case. No compassion for students and only judges exams based of her views. Would not recommend to take her class to any student who needs this credit for their major.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This class was frustrating the instructor constantly was suspicious about cheating which made the environment feel untrusting. Assignments piled up and were all due at the end of the week, making it hard to keep up. Emails went unanswered. I wish I had withdrawn when I had the chance. I received a 0 and was reported to SCAI because of her suspicion
Worst!!Worst!!Worst!! What I have learned it all from me. She is only concerned about cheating, not teaching.

She reported me in SCAI because I was looking around a little bit in the lockdown exam. That does not mean I am cheating. I explained but she still reported it to SCAI and also gave me a 0 on that exam. I studied so hard for the exam but she does not care. Do not take her online.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: LOVE LOVE LOVE this lady! She's very passionate about the topics and so sweet. She gives out a lot of extra credit that's literally the only reason I made an A in her class. She will take the time to meet with you and get to know you (your career goals and everything). The class is as hard as you make it.

I was skeptical about taking Dr. Fowlkes due to the reviews from previous courses, but I 100% recommend her for A&P 2. Such an attentive professor who cares about the success of students. I learned more in Dr. Fowlkes class than what I originally thought I would! Extra credit available throughout the entire semester. Put time/effort & you'll pass!!

Dr. Fowlkes is an engaging and knowledgeable instructor who genuinely cares about her students. She provides plenty of opportunities for extra credit and encourages participation, which helps reinforce the material. While study guides and notes could be more detailed, her dedication to student success makes her a great professor.

A&P is hard, but she makes it understandable. Exams are easy if you study the material she gives you (lecture, drawings, hw, etc). She gives a lot of work, which helps when taking the exam, but she will also drop a lot of assignments. Offers extra credit. Take her if you have a good work ethic! She's one of the best anatomy professors.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She's amazing. She makes A&P 2 easier to understand. She is fast paced but records her lectures. Exams are easy if you study the powerpoint and use the resources she gives. Offers extra credit. Tells you everything you need to know for exams. Assigns a lot of work but also drops some assignments. Do the work & study and you are guaranteed an A.

Dr. Fowlkes is one of the best professors I've ever had. Bioethics is usually an easy class for most but she makes the class worth taking. I came into the class thinking it would be boring but she does a great job at engaging with the class lectures. She's personable as she makes sure to know her students on a first name basis and she's relatable.

I think a lot of the professor difficulty rating is from A&P I and II being difficult courses in and of themselves. Her lectures were very informative, and she gave use plenty of resources and advice for studying that helped in her classes and other courses. Pushed us to work hard, and I think it paid off.
A&P is hard but this professor gives students great study guides, extra resources to help for exams. Her lectures are fast paced but she covers everything you need to know. Highly suggest.

I took Dr. Fowlkes for A&P 1 lab and she is a great professor, very knowledgeable and caring. She genuinely wants you to do good and gives you as many pointers as she can. She also makes sure you know the material before you come out of lab.
She is super sweet i took A&P lab she gives great tips and tricks, if you go to class and pay attention you'll be just fine
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: As far as the study of anatomy goes, Dr Fowlkes was pretty easy. It is a lot of information, but the exams aren't set up as trick questions and there are plenty of assignments and opportunities for extra credit in the lectures. I took BIO2251, 2251L, 2252, and 2252L all with her. I recommend her class, I found it way easier than I expected.

It was Just a horribly overall organized class, maybe because it was a summer course, but it made absolutely 0 sense of what was due and when. She would post links in D2L to assignments saying "this is whats is due" and then the link would be broken and the assignments tab would have a different name from what was on the syllabus and the directions

rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: the classwork was easy but it being the summer it was crammed- I would take this course over the fall or spring semester- cause I personally felt like I learned nothing. she provides extra credit. and drops some assignments as well- I do feel that the homework and the test don't quite align with the textbooks and such.

Dr. Fowlkes is a good professor, however I would not take her for lecture but rather for lab. She teaches way too fast and her PowerPoints are a bit disorganized. However, she is extremely nice and answers emails almost immediately. As a lab professor, she is the best. You will walk out of each lab knowing most of the material already for the test.

I recommend taking her for both lab and lecture. She offers many extra credit opportunities and truly cares for her students. I would 100% take her again. Has great lectures, although they are not mandatory but recommended.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: she is an amazing person and it shows by the way she teaches. A&P2 is such a challenging class and she is a great person to work with and learn from. she does the best she can with the material. she's so caring and always there if you need any extra help outside of class. take her!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Good personality, condescending at times though. Very straightforward in her lectures. Make quizlets with the terms from the powerpoints, no reason to copy notes. You won't know what to really focus on when studying because the practice quizzes, homework, and powerpoints don't match up. 4 tests, final was broken up into a take home and in person.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Fowlkes assigns way too much work for a 3 credit class. Four quizzes, 3-4 homeworks, an exam, and a discussion post almost every week (where you have to respond to classmates on different days). The materials are easy enough, and there are lots of opportunities for extra credit, but the sheer volume makes it almost impossible to keep up.
Professor Fowlkes was my lab professor. Professor Fowlkes is a really good teacher and makes sure you understand the materials she taught for that day.

I took her for spring 2023 and she was an amazing anatomy teacher. I believe this was her first semester so the structure of the class might change over the semesters. I would recommend going to the office hours and attending all lectures. Also her tests are advanced so you have to study/review some time before. Overall I would take her class again

Dr. Fowlkes' class wasn't that bad. I would advise that you read the textbook and complete ALL assignments. Trust me, it will count. I actually liked her class and the fact she gave extra credit. The exams could be a little challenging, but if you read the textbook, you should do just fine. It is a lot of content so take notes.

Never answers email so good luck getting questions answered outside of class.
MasteringBio HW cushions grade - she gives 2 attempts per HW. Extra credit given on exams. She posts "study guides" which are just learning objectives from the textbook. Her exams don't really align with how her powerpoints word things. She can be condescending at times.

She has great lessons, but fails to provide accurate study guides for her tests. She is not very tech-savvy so most emails go unanswered. The tests are not too hard if you read the text, but difficult if you rely on PowerPoint. Overall, I would not take her class again.

Avoid at all cost. Her lectures are super simple so you think you will do good, but the test and homework are not. You get a notecard, but good luck figuring out what to even put on there. If you have to take her, read ahead in the book and study vocab from the book. Good thing is, she does give a good amount of bonus and a curve for every test.

APII (idk why it's not an option) 
I am very thankful for Dr.Fowlkes, she is by far in my top 3 professors at KSU. Very lecture heavy. She is very helpful outside of class as she holds two study sessions per week with her personally. She gives the class a warm feeling. Gives so much extra credit. DO IT. Test can be difficult. Study in DEPTH.

Dr. Fowlkes is probably one of the most caring professors at Kennesaw. We had weekly discussion posts (300 words), in class study case assignments, two tests, and a final. She is very up front about her expectations, but is understanding when it comes to certain things. This class was far from boring and going to class was surprisingly fun!

Dr. Fowlkes is really easy to talk to and is easily accessible via email. Her class includes weekly in-class participation and writing prompts (300 words), two tests, and a final. It's not a difficult course; just show up and be courteous.
I was far from a model student, but she will work with you to help you excel in class.

She seems nice but can be a little disorganized. I've emailed her multiple times about needing to miss class due to family emergencies/situations but never responded and gave me a zero for the assignment. Many group assignments but they're easy. Her practice exams (when she posts them) are very similar to the actual exam, so take that as you will.
